alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:17PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Orange County through 800 PM EDT... At 713 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms developing along a line extending from Fairview to near Cuddebackville. This line of developing strong thunderstorms was moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Middletown, Port Jervis, Walden, Howells, Montgomery, Cuddebackville, Otisville, Huguenot, Scotchtown, Deerpark, Pine Bush, Circleville and Bullville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
